suites.title: Challange 1: function addTwo accepts one input and adds 2 to it.

tests.title: expect 2+1 = 3
tests.fullTitle: CallBack and High Order Functions Challange 1: function addTwo accepts one input and adds 2 to it. expect 2+1 = 3

suites.title: Challange 2: a function addS that accepts one input and adds an 'S' to it.

tests.title: pizza should be pizzas
tests.fullTitle: CallBack and High Order Functions Challange 2: a function addS that accepts one input and adds an 'S' to it. pizza should be pizzas

suites.title:
Challange 3: a function called map takes an array of numbers and
            a callback function which is applied to each element of the array.
            map returns a new array with the result of using the callback on each element

tests.title: returned array is a new array
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Challange 3: a function called map takes an array of numbers and
            a callback function which is applied to each element of the array.
            map returns a new array with the result of using the callback on each element returned array is a new array

tests.title: input of [1,2,3,4,5] should be [2,4,6,8,10] when the callback is multiplyByTwo
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Challange 3: a function called map takes an array of numbers and
            a callback function which is applied to each element of the array.
            map returns a new array with the result of using the callback on each element input of [1,2,3,4,5] should be [2,4,6,8,10] when the callback is multiplyByTwo

suites.title:
Challange 4:The function forEach takes an array and a callback,
                and runs the callback on each element of the array.
                forEach does not return anything.

tests.title: input of [a,b,c,d] should be 'abcd'
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Challange 4:The function forEach takes an array and a callback,
                and runs the callback on each element of the array.
                forEach does not return anything. input of [a,b,c,d] should be 'abcd'

suites.title:
Extension 1: rebuild map as mapWith. This time you're going to use
        forEach inside of mapWith instead of using a for loop.

tests.title: result array is a new array
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 1: rebuild map as mapWith. This time you're going to use
        forEach inside of mapWith instead of using a for loop. result array is a new array

tests.title: input of [a,b,c,d] should be abcde when the callback is multiplyByTwo
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 1: rebuild map as mapWith. This time you're going to use
        forEach inside of mapWith instead of using a for loop. input of [a,b,c,d] should be abcde when the callback is multiplyByTwo

suites.title:
Extension 2 :The function reduce takes an array and reduces the elements to a single value.
            For example it can sum all the numbers, multiply them,
            or any operation that you can put into a function.

tests.title: must have an initial value
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 2 :The function reduce takes an array and reduces the elements to a single value.
            For example it can sum all the numbers, multiply them,
            or any operation that you can put into a function. must have an initial value

tests.title: [1,2,3] should be reduced to 6 by using a sum function
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 2 :The function reduce takes an array and reduces the elements to a single value.
            For example it can sum all the numbers, multiply them,
            or any operation that you can put into a function. [1,2,3] should be reduced to 6 by using a sum function

suites.title:
Extension 3 : Construct a function intersection that compares input arrays and returns
             a new array with elements found in all of the inputs. BONUS: Use reduce!

tests.title: Intersection of [1,2,3] , [2,3,4,5] ,[1,3,2,4,5] returns [2,3]
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 3 : Construct a function intersection that compares input arrays and returns
             a new array with elements found in all of the inputs. BONUS: Use reduce! Intersection of [1,2,3] , [2,3,4,5] ,[1,3,2,4,5] returns [2,3]

suites.title:
Extension 4: Construct a function union that compares input arrays and returns a new array that contains all elements.
              If there are duplicate elements, only add it once to the new array.
              Preserve the order of the elements starting from the first element of the first input array. BONUS: Use reduce!

tests.title: returned array should be a new array
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 4: Construct a function union that compares input arrays and returns a new array that contains all elements.
              If there are duplicate elements, only add it once to the new array.
              Preserve the order of the elements starting from the first element of the first input array. BONUS: Use reduce! returned array should be a new array

tests.title: union of [1,2,3],[2,3,4,5] and [0,2,3] should equal [1,2,3,4,5]
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 4: Construct a function union that compares input arrays and returns a new array that contains all elements.
              If there are duplicate elements, only add it once to the new array.
              Preserve the order of the elements starting from the first element of the first input array. BONUS: Use reduce! union of [1,2,3],[2,3,4,5] and [0,2,3] should equal [1,2,3,4,5]

tests.title: preservers order of the input element arrays; starting from the first element of the first input array
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 4: Construct a function union that compares input arrays and returns a new array that contains all elements.
              If there are duplicate elements, only add it once to the new array.
              Preserve the order of the elements starting from the first element of the first input array. BONUS: Use reduce! preservers order of the input element arrays; starting from the first element of the first input array

tests.title: contains no duplicate elements
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 4: Construct a function union that compares input arrays and returns a new array that contains all elements.
              If there are duplicate elements, only add it once to the new array.
              Preserve the order of the elements starting from the first element of the first input array. BONUS: Use reduce! contains no duplicate elements

suites.title:
Extension 5 :A Function objOfMatches accepts two arrays and a callback.
             objOfMatches will build an object and return it. To build the object, objOfMatches will
             test each element of the first array using the callback to see if the output matches the corresponding element (by index)
              of the second array. If there is a match, the element from the first array becomes a key in an object,
             and the element from the second array becomes the corresponding value.

tests.title:
Objectmatches when passed values [hi, howdy,bye,later,hello]} and [HI,Howdy,BYE,LATER,hello]} will return
                    { hi: 'HI', bye: 'BYE', later: 'LATER' }
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 5 :A Function objOfMatches accepts two arrays and a callback.
             objOfMatches will build an object and return it. To build the object, objOfMatches will
             test each element of the first array using the callback to see if the output matches the corresponding element (by index)
              of the second array. If there is a match, the element from the first array becomes a key in an object,
             and the element from the second array becomes the corresponding value.  Objectmatches when passed values [hi, howdy,bye,later,hello]} and [HI,Howdy,BYE,LATER,hello]} will return
                    { hi: 'HI', bye: 'BYE', later: 'LATER' }

suites.title:
Extension 6: a function multiMap  will accept two arrays: an array of values and an array of callbacks.
                    multiMap will return an object whose keys match the elements in the array of values.
                    The corresponding values that are assigned to the keys will be arrays consisting of outputs from the array of callbacks,
                    where the input to each callback is the key.

tests.title:
MultipMap(['catfood', 'glue', 'beer'], [function(str) { return str.toUpperCase(); }, function(str) { return str[0].toUpperCase() + str.slice(1).toLowerCase(); }, function(str) { return str + str; }])
                        should return { catfood: ['CATFOOD', 'Catfood', 'catfoodcatfood'], glue: ['GLUE', 'Glue', 'glueglue'], beer: ['BEER', 'Beer', 'beerbeer'] }
tests.fullTitle:
CallBack and High Order Functions Extension 6: a function multiMap  will accept two arrays: an array of values and an array of callbacks.
                    multiMap will return an object whose keys match the elements in the array of values.
                    The corresponding values that are assigned to the keys will be arrays consisting of outputs from the array of callbacks,
                    where the input to each callback is the key. MultipMap(['catfood', 'glue', 'beer'], [function(str) { return str.toUpperCase(); }, function(str) { return str[0].toUpperCase() + str.slice(1).toLowerCase(); }, function(str) { return str + str; }])
                        should return { catfood: ['CATFOOD', 'Catfood', 'catfoodcatfood'], glue: ['GLUE', 'Glue', 'glueglue'], beer: ['BEER', 'Beer', 'beerbeer'] }

            it should print out the input that was used when the function was created.

suites.title:
Challange 3: Examine the code for the outer function. Notice that we are returning a function
              and that function is using variables that are outside of its scope.
              Uncomment those lines of code. Try to deduce the output before executing.

tests.title:
calling willCounter(); willCounter(); willCounter(); jasCounter(); willCounter()
                         should log out 1 ,2 ,3 ,1 and 4
tests.fullTitle:
Clousers, Scope and Execution Contenxt Challange 3: Examine the code for the outer function. Notice that we are returning a function
              and that function is using variables that are outside of its scope.
              Uncomment those lines of code. Try to deduce the output before executing.  calling willCounter(); willCounter(); willCounter(); jasCounter(); willCounter()
                         should log out 1 ,2 ,3 ,1 and 4

challange 4:Now we are going to create a function addByX
              that returns a function that will add an input by x.

tests.title: addByTwo(1) , addByTwo(2) and addByTwo(3) should be equal 3,4,5 respectively

Clousers, Scope and Execution Contenxt challange 4:Now we are going to create a function addByX

suites.title:
Challange 5: Write a function once that accepts a callback as input and
              returns a function. When the returned function is called the first time,
              it should call the callback and return that output.
              If it is called any additional times,
              instead of calling the callback again it will simply return the
              output value from the first time it was called.

tests.title:
when once(addByTwo) is called the first time is should return 6
                        after that when its called it should return 6
tests.fullTitle:
Clousers, Scope and Execution Contenxt Challange 5: Write a function once that accepts a callback as input and
              returns a function. When the returned function is called the first time,
              it should call the callback and return that output.
              If it is called any additional times,
              instead of calling the callback again it will simply return the
              output value from the first time it was called. when once(addByTwo) is called the first time is should return 6
                        after that when its called it should return 6

suites.title:
Challange 6 : Write a function after that takes
              the number of times the callback needs to be called
              before being executed as the first parameter and
              the callback as the second parameter.

tests.title: console logs hello after being called 3 times
tests.fullTitle:
Clousers, Scope and Execution Contenxt Challange 6 : Write a function after that takes
              the number of times the callback needs to be called
              before being executed as the first parameter and
              the callback as the second parameter. console logs hello after being called 3 times
